summary: chelsea have made an offer for fc tokyo 's 22 - year - old forward yoshinori muto , according to club president naoki ogane . the japan international , who has played for the j - league side since 2013 , will join chelsea 's dutch partner club vitesse arnhem on loan next season if he completes a move to stamford bridge this summer . ogane claims that chelsea 's interest in muto is not connected to the £ 200million sponsorship deal they signed with japanese company yokohama rubber in february .

aspect: 1. Chelsea made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto, according to club president Naoki Ogane.
2. Muto will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season if he completes a move to Stamford Bridge this summer.
3. Muto is the first Japanese player to represent Chelsea, with a £4 million deal mooted for him.
explain: Chelsea has shown interest in acquiring FC Tokyo's player Yoshinori Muto through an offer presented by their president Naoki Ogane, who stated that it is not connected to the recent sponsorship agreement with Yokohama Rubber.

Yoshinori Muto, a 22-year-old forward from FC Tokyo, is being pursued by Chelsea, with the option for him to join Vitesse Arnhem (Chelsea's Dutch partner club) on loan next season if the transfer takes place in summer.
Yoshinori Muto will potentially become the first Japanese player to join Chelsea, with a proposed £4 million deal, indicating his significance as a part of the team.
